div.div:
Please check our COVID-19 Information page for the most recent School news and updates on distance learning.
March 30, 2020
March 30, 2020 UPDATE: Free meals now approved for pickup at Legacy April 13-17. Legacy Charter School has been approved by the State as a site for picking up free meals April 13-17. Therefore, Legacy parents/guardians come to Legacy. You do not need to go to Liberty or Victory to receive free meals for your children. Free, cold lunch and breakfast combo meals for students and their siblings, ages 1-18, will be available daily for curbside pickup at Legacy Charter School District (4015 S. Legacy Way, Nampa) between 10:30 am –Noon while supplies last. The meals are to be taken and not consumed on site. Thank you.
ACTUALIZACIÓN del 30 de marzo de 2020: comidas gratuitas aprobadas para recoger en Legacy del 13 al 17 de abril. Legacy Charter School ha sido aprobada por el estado como un sitio para recoger comidas gratis del 13 al 17 de abril. Por lo tanto, los padres / tutores de Legacy vienen a Legacy. No necesita ir a Liberty o Victory para recibir comidas gratis para sus hijos. Comidas frías y gratuitas de almuerzo y desayuno para estudiantes y sus hermanos, de 1 a 18 años de edad, estarán disponibles diariamente para recoger en la acera en el Distrito Escolar Legacy Charter (4015 S. Legacy Way, Nampa) entre las 10:30 a.m. y el mediodía hasta agotar existencias . Las comidas deben tomarse y no consumirse en el sitio. Gracias.
Coronavirus Parent Letter - March 25, 2020
Parents – Thank you for your quick replies to the email yesterday, March 24, regarding your home WIFI access. We’re receiving good information from you that is greatly helping us put in place what we now know will be the need to use remote learning our first week back from spring break, April 13-17.
More details will be coming regarding the approaches we’ll use April 13-17 so you and your students can prepare. If you’ve yet to reply to yesterday’s email, please do so as soon as possible, letting us know if you do not have WIFI access, and if you will have challenges in providing devices (i.e., PCs, laptops, etc.) for your students to use at home. Although, we have access to limited devices, we will try our best to provide those with no devices. Once this information is collected we will be able to determine the best arrangements for offering school attendance options to ensure our students are learning in the most effective ways possible.
Also, for April 13-17, free, cold-lunch combo meals for students and their siblings, ages 1-18, will be available daily for curbside pickup at the school between 10:30 am –Noon while supplies last. The meals are to be taken and not consumed on site. Children must be present to receive a free meal.
If you know of parents who might not be receiving these emails for some reason, please let us know, so we can contact them another way, or please ask them to call the school office. We want to make sure everyone is receiving these updates. The way in which our school community is coming together has been incredible and we appreciate all our efforts in helping each other. Thank you for your ongoing support.
We will keep updating you as we approach April 13, and we will be working with families individually as necessary to ensure all our students have access to their education that week. Please keep checking your email inbox, the school website and Facebook for information.
We continue to stay positive in our hopes you all are well and that tomorrow, the first day of spring break, is one you can enjoy among the uncertainties.
Mr. Seth Stallcop
Administrator
Legacy Charter School #478
******************************************************
25 de marzo de 2020
Padres: gracias por sus rápidas respuestas al correo electrónico de ayer, 24 de marzo, con respecto al acceso WIFI de su hogar. Recibimos buena información suya que nos ayuda en gran medida a poner en práctica lo que ahora sabemos será la necesidad de utilizar el aprendizaje remoto nuestra primera semana de regreso del receso de primavera, del 13 al 17 de abril.
Llegarán más detalles sobre los enfoques que usaremos del 13 al 17 de abril para que usted y sus alumnos puedan prepararse. Si aún no ha respondido al correo electrónico de ayer, hágalo lo antes posible, infórmenos si no tiene acceso a WIFI y si tendrá problemas para proporcionar dispositivos (es decir, PC, computadoras portátiles, etc.) para sus alumnos para usar en casa. Aunque, tenemos acceso a dispositivos limitados, haremos todo lo posible para proporcionar a los que no tienen dispositivos. Una vez que se recopile esta información, podremos determinar los mejores arreglos para ofrecer opciones de asistencia a la escuela para asegurar que nuestros estudiantes estén aprendiendo de la manera más efectiva posible.
Además, del 13 al 17 de abril, habrá comidas combinadas gratuitas de almuerzo frío para estudiantes y sus hermanos, de 1 a 18 años, disponibles diariamente para que los recojan en la escuela en la escuela entre las 10:30 a.m. y el mediodía hasta agotar existencias. Las comidas deben tomarse y no consumirse en el sitio. Los niños deben estar presentes para recibir una comida gratis.
Si conoce a los padres que podrían no estar recibiendo estos correos electrónicos por alguna razón, háganoslo saber para que podamos contactarlos de otra manera, o pídales que llamen a la oficina de la escuela. Queremos asegurarnos de que todos reciban estas actualizaciones. La forma en que nuestra comunidad escolar se ha unido ha sido increíble y apreciamos todos nuestros esfuerzos para ayudarnos mutuamente. Gracias por su continua ayuda.
Seguiremos actualizando a medida que nos acercamos al 13 de abril, y trabajaremos con las familias individualmente según sea necesario para asegurar que todos nuestros estudiantes tengan acceso a su educación esa semana. Siga revisando su bandeja de entrada de correo electrónico, el sitio web de la escuela y Facebook para obtener información.
Seguimos siendo positivos con la esperanza de que todos estén bien y que mañana, el primer día de las vacaciones de primavera, sea uno de los que pueda disfrutar entre las incertidumbres.
Mr. Seth Stallcop
Administrador
Legacy Charter School #478
Coronavirus Parent Letter - 3-24-2020
Hello Legacy Parents – we wanted to touch base with you before we technically begin our scheduled spring break, which runs from March 26-April 10.
As we continue to work to stay ahead of the COVID-19 curve while following the directives by health officials, our Governor, and the State Board of Education, we are committed to maintaining our high standards of education and safety for your students. Realizing this might require an online component, depending on where things stand in a couple of weeks, we want to be as prepared as possible.
Therefore, we need your assistance by providing the following information to us as soon as possible:
If you do not have WIFI access at home, please reply to office@legacycharterschool.net saying so, making sure to include the names and grades of your students attending our school. While our teachers have a pretty good idea of which families might be without WIFI service, we want to do our best to confirm the information. Thank you for your quick replies.
We will remain in contact with you over spring break, so please be sure to check email often, as well as the school’s website and social media.
Take care and stay well,
Mr. Seth Stallcop
Administrator
Coronavirus Parent Letter - Shut down 3-16-2020
​
Legacy Charter closed March 17-April 10
Legacy Charter cerrado del 17 de marzo al 10 de abril
​Para continuar nuestros esfuerzos de ser excesivamente cautelosos mientras servimos mejor a nuestros estudiantes, personal y familias, la escuela permanecerá cerrada a partir del mañana 17 de marzo y permanecerá cerrada hasta el viernes 10 de abril.
El personal limitado estará en la escuela del 17 al 20 de marzo y del 23 al 25 de marzo para que los padres y estudiantes recojan sus pertenencias personales, etc., si es necesario.
Mientras la escuela está cerrada, continúe practicando el distanciamiento social, practicando una higiene personal sólida y siguiendo las últimas pautas de los CDC y Southwest District Health.
Coronavirus Parent Letter - Shut down
Coronavrius Parent Letter - Shut down - Spanish

div.br: Parents – Due to continuing concerns regarding Corornavirus/COVID-19 and our efforts to prevent the introduction and spread of the virus in our school and among our families, spring parent-teacher conferences have been cancelled. If you have concerns regarding your student and would like to meet with her/his teacher(s) before the end of the school year, please contact the teacher to arrange a time to meet. Likewise, if there are students in which teachers are concerned, their parents will be contacted by the teacher. Thank you for your understanding and care as we continue to keep our school community safe and healthy.

​

br.font: - Please join us for the presentation of Rockin' Through the Ages by 5th and 6th grade at 6:00

strong.font: LEGACY NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED FOR SUCCESS IN 2018

br.font: December 7, 2018: The National Association of ESEA State Program Administrators (NAESPA) is pleased to announce that Legacy Charter School from Nampa, Idaho, has been named a National ESEA Distinguished School by the state education agency in Idaho. Legacy is one of up to 100 schools throughout the country that is being nationally recognized for exceptional student achievement in 2018.

A project of the NAESPA, the National ESEA Distinguished Schools Program publicly recognizes qualifying federally funded schools for the outstanding academic achievements of their students. It highlights the efforts of schools across the country making significant improvements for their students. The program has been in place since 1996, showcasing the success of hundreds of schools in one of three categories:
• Category 1: Exceptional student performance for two consecutive years
• Category 2: Closing the achievement gap between student groups
• Category 3: Excellence in serving special populations of students

The Elementary and Secondary Education Act (ESEA) provides additional resources for vulnerable students and federal grants to state educational agencies to improve the quality of public elementary and secondary education.

The Association is a membership organization made up of State ESEA Program Administrators, and their staff from each of the states and territories, charged with managing their state federal education program. They ensure compliance with federal regulations, but more importantly work to see that all children — especially those living in economically disadvantaged conditions — have the opportunity to receive a high quality education.

NAESPA implements the National ESEA Distinguished Schools Program to highlight selected schools that have successfully used their ESEA federal funds to improve the education for all students–including economically disadvantaged students. More information about all National ESEA Distinguished Schools is available on the ESEA Network website:

div.font: Legacy's mission is to develop students who are competent, confident, productive and responsible young adults who possess the habits, skills and attitudes to succeed in life.
Legacy Charter School is grounded in the belief that when there is low threat and content is highly challenging, accelerated learning takes place.

br.em: To view the school's Annual Report card from the Idaho State Department of Education, click on the link and then type in our school's name in the top left corner and then click on the school's name that pops up in school listings in the right-hand column. Please note: Our school is considered its own District as it is authorized by the Idaho Public Charter School Commission. Therefore, you will see that our school and district outcomes under the Academic Indicators tab are identical. If you would like to compare our school's outcomes with another nearby traditional school district and/or traditional school, click on "Back to finder" and enter the school and/or district name in which you're interested.

h2.font: CLICK TO DOWNLOAD LEGACY'S ATTENDANCE POLICY

font.br: Legacy is committed to duplicating the highly successful educational model founded by Liberty Charter School in Nampa, and replicated by its Nampa sister school, Victory Charter School. This educational program, the Harbor School Method™, centers on the belief that education should be child-centered and built on high expectations for both student behavior and academic endeavor. In a Harbor School, decisions on every level are based on the question, “What’s best for kids?” The method also proactively sets up an environment that allows students to focus on learning, while in a safe and secure setting.
